data.title: add mult-camera render to viewport crash in 5.3.4
Flowgraph in 5.4 preview full of deprecated things
data.body: Without GameSDK  weapons, vehicles, actors, and much more, are all deprecated in the engine and should be marked as such in Flowgraph or removed completely unless the GameSDK is used. Very confusing if I create my own weapon classes and Flowgraph has another idea of what a weapon is. Also very difficult to use Flowgraph when there are so many deprecated and old stuff there.

data.title: Editor crash when level.pak does not exist in level folder
data.body:
Reproduction steps:

- Download preview 5 release from: https://github.com/CRYTEK/CRYENGINE/releases/tag/5.4.0_preview5
- Open Templates/ThirdPersonShooter template in Editor
- Export to engine
- Close editor, go to ThirdPersonShooter/Assets/levels/example and delete `level.pak`
- Open Editor again, try to open the example level - editor crashes


[error.zip](https://github.com/CRYTEK/CRYENGINE/files/1266934/error.zip)

data.title: !T (3DEngine) Fix typo in listener name
!T (Schematyc) Correct typo in log message
The engine can not create caves like the Unreal Engine
data.body: The engine can not create caves like the Unreal Engine, because all the tools are vertical and have no horizontal direction. So far I have not seen any of this engine produced cave internal scene. So I was thinking of a new method, with the route guide to quickly generate caves, with a deformable wire frame cut into the mountain to limit the cave horizon. Making caves like paving karate pipelines that cross the mountain.

fix devision by zero
Terrain.layer Stopping Problem
data.body:
My symptoms are like this.
If i change the terrain layer shader and then reload the material (when you restart the editor) or click it, the editor will stop.
It's okay if the shader is illum or something else.
The material is in a terrain layer state.
<< Summary >>
- The height map extracted from the `Displacement` preset in Crytif A stop phenomenon occurs after connecting to the Heightmap of Terrainlayer material.
-After saving the material, it resumes and stops even if the material is re-selected.
-When the height map is removed from the input, the paused scene disappears.
-Extracting the displacement map as an `Albedo` preset will not stop it.

The image below is the situation at the time.
![k-003](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22741645/29801587-75f40fb0-8cab-11e7-975a-ca66cb5f8a71.png)
![k-001](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22741645/29801617-98884e74-8cab-11e7-8c76-067abcafb168.png)
![k-002](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/22741645/29801622-9aa5cd80-8cab-11e7-9fd6-a38c0f20294c.png)
cryversion.5.3.4
photoshop CC(2014)

data.title: !R (CMake/CryRun) CMakeLists detection additions
data.body:
!B (CMake/CryRun) Fixed corruption due to source-less default project
!T (CMake/CryRun) Always generate CMakeLists (even if no sources present)
!T (CMake/Configure) CE_EXTENSION_NAME overrides solution name

Added ability to rename generated solution file by setting the cmake variable "CE_EXTENSION_NAME" before including configure.cmake.
Added Auto Detection: Project name / Solution folder (via, ${ProjectName}/CryFileContainer/project/CryEngineModule).
Added Auto Detection: Module Type (no source = hidden project. only .h = CryFileContainer. at least one .cpp = CryEngineModule).
Added Detection: Set CMake variable 'CE_EXTENSION_NAME' before including Configure.cmake to override output solution name.

data.title: Component lifecycle inconsistency (quick fix before 5.4 please?)
data.body:
It seems like there is no reliable and reasonable way at all for one component to run a piece of code after ALL the components of an entity has been initialized.

There also seems to be a practice of physicalizing inside the Initialize method of components which I can't make sense out of. Components should act together to form an entity, so the physicalization should take place after all components have been initialized, and not when the entity is in a semi-initialized state.

I think this is a architectural bug, because if one component's physical state can be affected by another component, then we should initialize all components first and then ask them to physicalize.

This issue is not limited to physicalization but is very general.

I found the ENTITY_EVENT_INIT event which can be used _sometimes_. The event is sent after all components have been Initialized. But it is not sent for spawned entities. My temporary workaround for this is to manually send this event every time I spawn an event, so that I can always do first-time logic when the entity is in a fully-initialized state.

I think this issue can and should be fixed before 5.4 launch. It is very easy - add a new event and call it ENTITY_EVENT_PHYSICALIZE or ENTITY_EVENT_BEGIN or whatever. Send this event if all its components have been initialized and when the entity is added to the world.

For spawned entities, the entity system needs to keep track of newly spawned entities and send them this event just like it deals with m_deletedEntities in EntitySystem.cpp line 1026. Simply loop through a list of spawned entities and send them the BEGIN event and then clear the list.

For non-spawned entities, this event need to be sent where ENTITY_EVENT_INIT is sent (after component initialization, before world update).

When adding a new component to an existing and already added entity, this component should receive the event immediately after its Initialize has been called.

Practical example of how and why this is an architectural issue: The CCharacterControllerComponent physicalizes itself in its Initialize function. I have a component that in its Initialize function calls GetOrCreateComponent on the CCharacterControllerComponent. This effectively forces the order of initialization to first initialize the CCharacterControllerComponent and then my component. That is an issue because if I want to modify a few physics properties first I can't do that. I understand that there are hacky ways of solving this by grabbing the physical entity and modifying it but that is just what I am talking about, an architectural issue.

How the proposed new event would solve the particular example of the CCharacterControllerComponent:
1) All components are initialized, CCharacterControllerComponent does NOT physicalize, but it exposes a physics params struct that my component can modify
2) All components receive the BEGIN event and physicalize from a **fully-initialized entity state**

Please consider adding this event before 5.4 since it would be the only reliable way of doing some component-relational logic before entities enter the world.

data.title: UX: AddMember on CTypeDesc in Schematyc does not error/warn with spaces in names
data.body:
When adding a member to a type desc for schematyc, there is no warning/error if the name parameter has a space in it (or another character that would be invalid in XML). 
The only actual warning about this is a log about malformed XML which you do not see until loading a level with the schematyc entity in the level - it would be preferred if there was an error here or a comment in the code for the AddMember function.
